etymology.description: 并(並) (bìng, "combine") is the simplified form of 並(並) → 厂(厂) (chǎng, "factory") morphed with 干(干) (gān, "stem") for a simplified structure
etymology.interpretation: The simplification of 並(並) to 并(並) involved streamlining the character by replacing parts with similar-sounding or conceptually related components, leading to a more concise form. 厂(厂) (chǎng) and 干(干) (gān) are visually more distinct yet phonetically linked.
etymology.simplification: 厂(厂) (chǎng, "factory") and 干(干) (gān, "stem") replaced the more complex structure of 並(並) for easier writing.

examples.chinese: 科学家并融合多学科知识(科學家並融合多學科知識)，设计创新实验(設計創新實驗)。
examples.pinyin: Kēxuéjiā bìng rónghé duō xuékē zhīshi, shèjì chuàngxīn shíyàn.
examples.english: The scientist combines knowledge from multiple disciplines and designs innovative experiments.

examples.chinese: 厨师并混合多种香料(廚師並混合多種香料)，制作独特佳肴(製作獨特佳肴)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī bìng hùnhé duō zhǒng xiāngliào, zhìzuò dútè jiāyáo.
examples.english: The chef combines various spices to create unique dishes.
